text.sentence: Energy | North America Oil Services and Drilling thirty one January two thousand fourteen

Initiatives Taking Hold: Cameron remains best positioned among the capital equipment makers to continue to grow backlog in two thousand fourteen; however, CAM is experiencing higher costs associated with ramping revenues off of record order levels.
For the past two years, sustaining margin expansion has been a frustrating exercise for both the company and investors.
Margins will face headwinds in early two thousand fourteen as CAM continues to take steps to add capacity, rationalize its cost structure and sustain reasonable levels of profitability.
We expect the pace of margin expansion to remain a key focus in two thousand fourteen and think the company is on a path to stabilizing margins in its most challenged business areas.

With a positive margin trajectory likely to take hold in the second half of the year, an aggressive share buyback program underway and the possibility of additional noncore asset divestitures looming, we think CAM offers a compelling buying opportunity.
Solid fourQ: CAM reported operating EPS of dollar one., above our estimate of dollar .ninety
The strong results were driven by robust sales as total revenue for the quarter exceeded our estimate by more than five percent .
EBITDA of dollar four hundred forty five million beat our dollar four hundred thirty three million estimate.
A Margin Trough in oneQ: CAM expects total EBITDA margins of thirteen fourteen percent in oneQ with the majority of the decline vs. the fifteen.one
percent margin in fourQ stemming from headwinds in the Drilling segment.
Surface and Subsea margins remain stable; however, CAM's Drilling business continues to struggle with capacity constraints.

The company expects a slow progression higher in DPS off the oneQ base and anticipates total EBITDA margins to range between fifteen sixteen percent in two thousand fourteen, an improvement relative to the fourteen.eight
Adjusting Estimates: We are adjusting our two thousand fourteenE EPS estimates to dollar three.eighty
We think the combination of self help cost improvement and the continued share buyback program will support the two thousand fourteen earnings outlook.
Our two thousand fifteenE EPS estimate of dollar four.fifty is unchanged as is our price target of dollar eighty two.

CAM is levered to several key secular trends which are likely to drive growth in the years to come, including the ongoing new offshore rig construction cycle, the retrofitting of offshore BOP equipment, and accelerating demand for subsea equipment globally.
Near term challanges have been a headwind to earnings growth, but the secular story remains intact.
Our upside case of dollar ninety five is based on an upside multiple of seventeen.ninex

In a more robust environment in North America and assuming a more accelerated pickup in international spending we think the company could earn dollar four.seventy five to dollar five.twenty five per share.
A stalling of the global economy or geopolitical issues could have a negative impact on demand for oil and gas, and consequently oil services.
Under this scenario we think EPS for CAM could be dollar three.ten

Cameron remains best positioned among the capital equipment makers to continue to grow backlog in two thousand fourteen.
However, CAM is experiencing higher costs associated with ramping revenues out of a record backlog.
For the past two years, sustaining margin expansion has been a frustrating exercise for both the company and investors.
Margins will face headwinds in early two thousand fourteen as CAM continues to take steps to add capacity, rationalize its cost structure and sustain reasonable levels of profitability.
We expect the pace of margin expansion to remain a key focus in two thousand fourteen and think the company is on a path to stabilizing margins in its most challenged business areas.

With a positive margin trajectory likely to take hold in the second half of the year, an aggressive share buyback program underway and the possibility of additional non core asset divestitures looming, we think CAM offers a compelling buying opportunity.
Cameron International reported fourQthirteen operating EPS of dollar one., above our estimate of dollar .ninety
From the results we excluded a number of one time items, including integration costs for OneSubsea, and litigation and restructuring costs which collectively lowered EPS by dollar .five.
The strong results were driven by robust sales as total revenue for the quarter exceeded our estimate by more than five percent .
Total revenue of dollar two thousand nine hundred thirty eight million increased eighteen percent sequentially and was higher than our dollar two thousand seven hundred eighty three million estimate.
EBITDA of dollar four hundred forty five million rose twenty one percent from the previous quarter and beat our estimate of dollar four hundred thirty three million.
New orders of dollar three.three billion increased ten percent sequentially and exceeded our estimate of dollar three.one billion.
fivex estimate as throughput for the period increased by over ten percentage points from the prior quarter and was higher than our forecast.
billion, up three percent from threeQ and thirty four percent from year end two thousand twelve levels.
Drilling and Production Systems orders of dollar two.two billion were flat from threeQ and in line with our estimate.
Valves and Measurements orders of dollar five hundred twenty six million expanded nearly six percent from the prior period and modestly beat our estimate of dollar five hundred twenty three million.

Process and Compression Systems orders surged over seventy five percent sequentially to dollar six hundred four million which was materially higher than our dollar three hundred sixty million forecast.
PCS orders were aided by a dollar two hundred fifty million COtwo separation order in Malaysia.
Cameron repurchased nearly dollar nine hundred seventy five million in shares in fourQ and reduced shares outstanding to two hundred twenty three million by year end two thousand thirteen .
At year end, the company had over dollar eight hundred forty million remaining on its buyback authorization and has further reduced the share count to two hundred nineteen million today.
We expect a further reduction over the course of two thousand fourteen and think Cameron could buy back another five million shares through fourQfourteen.

Revenue for the Drilling and Production Systems business of dollar one thousand nine hundred forty three million increased nineteen percent sequentially and was higher than our dollar one thousand eight hundred fifteen million forecast.
EBITDA of dollar three hundred nineteen million rose sixteen percent from the previous quarter but missed our dollar three hundred twenty two million estimate.
The margin at sixteen.four percent declined from sixteen.seven percent in threeQthirteen and was below our estimate of seventeen.seven
DPS orders of dollar two.two billion were relatively flat from threeQ levels.

The fourQ total included Drilling orders of dollar five hundred eighty five million, up forty four percent sequentially, and Drilling aftermarket orders of dollar two hundred thirty nine million, up five percent sequentially.
The dollar eight hundred twenty four million in total Drilling Systems orders was the second highest figure in CAM's history.
Segment backlog at dollar nine.five billion increased three percent over threeQ as book to bill was a healthy one.onex.

Surface Systems secured dollar five hundred thirty nine million in orders, up eighteen percent sequentially while Subsea orders totalled dollar eight hundred fifty one million, a twenty four percent decline from threeQ.
OneSubsea ...booked a significant award during the quarter ­ the Moho subsea processing system from Total.
CAM also announced a five year frame agreement with Woodside to engage in that company's deepwater development programs off Australia.
Valves and Measurements revenue of dollar five hundred twenty eight million increased five percent sequentially but was lower than our dollar five hundred thirty eight million estimate.
EBITDA at dollar one hundred fourteen million rose six percent from the prior period and met our dollar one hundred fifteen million forecast.
percent in the previous quarter and was above our twenty one.four
V and M orders of dollar five hundred twenty five million were up roughly five percent from threeQ.
Backlog for the segment dipped slightly to dollar one billion from dollar one.five billion in the previous quarter.
Orders for the quarter were slightly less than anticipated due to project slippages in Asia/Pac and the Gulf of Mexico.
Onshore engineered valve activity in the U.S. improved sequentially but is still below two thousand twelve levels while distributed valve orders remained elevated off a record threeQ.
Well infrastructure build outs in the U.S. land market are expanding the opportunity for distributed valves while demand drivers for the remainder of the business have favorable tail winds.
CAM expects V and M orders to grow ten percent year over year in two thousand fourteen with most of the uptick occurring in the back half of the year.
The margin outlook is stable at ~twenty one percent which is consistent with recent periods.

Revenue for the Process and Compression Systems business of dollar four hundred sixty seven million increased thirty one percent sequentially and was higher than our dollar four hundred twenty nine million forecast.
EBITDA of dollar seventy three million rose sixty nine percent from the previous quarter and beat our dollar sixty one million estimate.

CAM recently announced its intention to exit the compression business and has plans to sell its Reciprocating Compression unit to GE while pursuing strategic alternative for its Centrifugal Compression operation.
The company will begin reporting the compression units as dis continued operations starting in oneQ with a resulting dilution to EPS of ~ dollar .two.

The remaining PCS businesses should generate between dollar one billion and dollar one.one billion in revenue in two thousand fourteen with EBITDA margins expanding from roughly ten percent in oneQ to between one thousand four hundred fifteen percent by year end.
We are adjusting our two thousand fourteenE EPS estimates to dollar three.eighty
We think the combination of self help cost improvement and the continued share buyback program will support the two thousand fourteen earnings outlook.
Our two thousand fifteenE EPS estimate of dollar four.fifty is unchanged as is our price target of dollar eighty two.
Our dollar eighty two price target is based on eighteen.twox
Our price target multiple represents a ten percent premium to the oil service group's target multiple of sixteen.fivex.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Corporate and Investment Banking Division of Barclays is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: A material change in commodity prices would alter our earnings outlook and potentially our stance on the entire oil service and drilling sector.
Commodity price changes could be affected by a change in the economic climate, gas storage levels, OPEC behavior, increasing non OPEC oil production, and international political and economic risks.
